When a creature makes a melee attack against you, you can use your reaction to interpose the illusory duplicate between the attacker and yourself, causing the creature to have disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Necromancy Form
entries: Your healing powers are augmented. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature other than you, a surge of the healing energy courses through you and you regain hit points equal to the spell's level + your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Transmutation Form
entries: You can alter your physical characteristics in order to adapt in different situations. After taking bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.
You remain in your arcane form for 10 minutes, until you are reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to assume an arcane form again, or until you die.

subclassFeature.name: Summon Mana Spirit
entries: {@i 6th-level Circle of Mana feature}
You learn how to give physical form to mana. As an action, you can expend one spell slot to summon a {@creature mana spirit|CoH-CAPG}.

The spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. It is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the {@creature Mana Spirit|CoH-CAPG} stat block, which uses the level of the spell slot (SL) expended to summon the spirit in several places. You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of pure arcane energy, while others look like beasts wreathed in violent magics.

In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the spirit can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.
The spirit manifests for 1 minute, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon a spirit again, or until you die.

subclassFeature.name: One With the Mana
entries: {@i 10th-level Circle of Mana feature}

You learn how to share your own power with a {@creature mana spirit|CoH-CAPG}. While in your {@subclassFeature Arcane Form|Druid||Mana|CoH-CAPG|2|CoH-CAPG}, any {@creature mana spirit|CoH-CAPG} you summon gains the chosen form's benefits, using your druid level whenever necessary.

subclassFeature.name: Favored by the Mana
entries: {@i 14th-level Circle of Mana feature}

Your connection with the mana grows strong enough that magic is unwilling to cause you harm. While in your {@subclassFeature Arcane Form|Druid||Mana|CoH-CAPG|2|CoH-CAPG}, you and any {@creature mana spirit|CoH-CAPG} you summon have resistance to damage from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Witch Knight
entries: Some warriors seek the help of unearthly forces to achieve their goals. Witch Knights are fighters that attain magical powers through pacts with such forces, bargaining their very souls. Often called Maledictors, they specialize in the weaving of curses in addition to displays of expert swordplay.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: {@i 3rd-level Witch Knight feature}
Through your pact with uncanny forces, you've been granted the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: Choose one of the Otherworldly Patrons available to the {@class warlock} class. The spells on the Expanded Spell List of that patron are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two {@filter cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock|level=0}. You learn an additional cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witch Knight Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your warlock spells. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level or Higher
entries: You learn two 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}. The Spells Known column of the Witch Knight Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of 1st-level or higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the warlock spells you know with another spell from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Maledictor's Curse
entries: {@i 3rd-level Witch Knight feature}

You learn potent curses. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and curse it with a curse you know. A curse placed on a target lasts for 1 minute, until the target dies, until you place another curse on the target or until the target is targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curses
entries: You learn two curses of your choice, which are detailed under {@filter "Maledictor's Curses"|optionalfeatures|feature type=Mal. Curse} below. You learn one additional curse of your choice at 7th, 10th, 15th and 18th level. Each time you learn new curses, you can also replace a curse you know with a different one.

entries.name: Empowered Curses
entries: When you curse a creature, you can expend one spell slot to empower the curse affecting the target, granting it additional effects. These effects are detailed in each curse's description.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your curses require your target to make a saving throw to resist the curse's effects. The saving throw DC is equal to your warlock spell save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Guidance
entries: {@i 7th-level Witch Knight feature}
When you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1}, you regain one use of your {@subclassFeature Maledictor's Curse|Fighter||Witch Knight|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG}.

In addition, after you empower a curse placed on a creature with your {@subclassFeature Maledictor's Curse|Fighter||Witch Knight|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG} feature, you gain advantage on all weapon attacks you make against the target until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bewitching Strikes
entries: {@i 10th-level Witch Knight feature}

The dark powers you wield weaken those you wound in battle. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast or your curses before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Charge
entries: {@i 15th-level Witch Knight feature}

When you use your {@classFeature Action Surge|Fighter||2}, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of a creature cursed by your {@subclassFeature Maledictor's Curse|Fighter||Witch Knight|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG}. You can teleport before or after the additional action (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Accursed Offering
entries: {@i 18th-level Witch Knight feature}

When a creature that's cursed by your {@subclassFeature Maledictor's Curse|Fighter||Witch Knight|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG} dies within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to regain one of your expended {@subclassFeature Pact Magic|Fighter||Witch Knight|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG} spell slots or move the curse to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of you.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Weave
entries: Monks following the Way of the Weave believe magic to be the one true answer to the enigma that is existence. They hone their ki by connecting to the mana of the world, becoming part of the Weave and learning how to manipulate magic. Most of these monks train relentlessly and in solitude, yet they find great company in arcane scholars and mages, always eager to exchange information and theories. Some others choose to join various organisations that hunt villainous spellcasters, holding the firm belief that the Art is pure and a force for good.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of the Weave feature}
When you choose this tradition, you form a connection to the Weave allowing you to shape a portion of your Ki into spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three {@filter cantrips of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. You learn an additional wizard cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Way of the Weave Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your wizard spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell magic missile} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three {@filter 1st-level wizard spells|spells|class=wizard|level=1} of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Way of the Weave Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the wizard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells, since you learned your spells through deep meditation on the aspects of the Weave. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you can cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Weave Technique
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of the Weave feature}
Blending martial arts with magic has enlightened you, granting you intricate knowledge and skill. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: As a bonus action, you can spend 1 ki point to conjure an arcane weapon into one of your free hands. The arcane weapon must be a {@filter simple or martial weapon that lacks the heavy and special properties|items|type=simple weapon;martial weapon|property=!heavy;!special|miscellaneous=mundane}. While wielding an arcane weapon, you are considered proficient with it and it counts as a monk weapon for you. The weapon's damage type becomes force. If the arcane weapon has multiple damage types, all of its damage types become force. An arcane weapon vanishes after a minute of it being conjured or as a bonus action on your turn if you choose to dismiss it. When you attack with an arcane weapon, you can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Arcane Flurry
entries: When you use your action on your turn to cast a wizard spell, you can make an unarmed strike or an attack with an arcane weapon as a bonus action. At 6th level, immediately after you use your action on your turn to cast a wizard spell, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes or two attacks with an arcane weapon as a bonus action.

entries.name: Unearth Arcana
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} skill and you can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Intelligence modifier whenever you make an {@skill Arcana} check.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Way of the Weave Technique
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Weave feature}
Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can cast one of your wizard cantrips in place of one of your attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Channeling
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Weave feature}

When you cast a wizard spell of 1st level or higher, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of ki points equal to 1 + the spell's level. If you cast the spell using ki points, it requires no verbal or somatic components, and it requires no material components, unless they are consumed by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: One With Magic
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of the Weave feature}
As your understanding of arcane magic grows, so does your prowess. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane Empowerment
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an arcane weapon, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Disrupt Magic
entries: After you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an arcane weapon, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your ki save DC. On a failed save, you can expend a number of ki points up to your proficiency bonus. The target is unable to cast spells with a level equal to or lower than the number of ki points you expended until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Improved Arcane Weapons
entries: When you conjure an arcane weapon, you can expend up to 3 ki points to grant it a bonus to attack and damage rolls when you attack with it. The bonus equals the number of ki points you spent. This bonus lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Grandmaster of the Way of the Weave
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of the Weave feature}
Learning the strength of magic has also aided you in evading its harmful effects by reading the flow of magic around you. You have advantage on saving throws you make against spells.

In addition, when you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you and would still affect you on a successful save (such as a {@spell fireball} spell), the spell has no effect on you instead.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Witchbane
entries: The Oath of the Witchbane is sworn by paladins that take action against vile spellcasters that abuse the Weave to wreak havoc on innocent souls. Often called Inquisitors, Seekers or Spelleaters, these paladins promote the benevolent use of magic and hunt their enemies with incredible fervor.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Witchbane
entries: A paladin that takes the Oath of the Witchbane swears to hunt the abusers of magic and safeguard the Weave.

entries.name: Guide the Gifted
entries: Respect those granted magic and help guide them towards a pious path.

entries.name: Know the Enemy
entries: Arcane, divine and primal are just different manifestations of the Weave. Understand the inner workings of magic to better pursue your enemies.

entries.name: Purge the Abusers
entries: Magic is a gift of life, not a tool for destruction. Those who abuse it deserve no mercy.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: {@i 3rd-level Oath of the Witchbane feature}
You gain the following two Channel Divinity options. See the {@classFeature Sacred Oath|Paladin||3} class feature for how {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} works.

subclassFeature.name: Disjunction Shackles
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to restrict the use of magic. As an action, you present your {@item holy symbol|PHB} and each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes unable to cast spells or expend spell slots for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Parry
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||3} to deflect spells. When you or another creature that you can see within 10 feet of you is targeted by a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to parry the spell. Make an attack roll with a melee weapon you're holding, contested by the caster's spellcasting ability check. If you succeed, the spell has no effect on you or the creature within 10 feet of you that it targeted. In addition, if you succeed by 5 or more, you can redirect the spell as part of this reaction, choosing a new target for it and using the slot level of the caster, but your paladin spell save DC, spell attack bonus and spellcasting ability.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Nullification
entries: {@i 8th-level Oath of the Witchbane feature}

You emit an aura that nullifies harmful spells. When you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you takes damage from a spell, that damage is reduced by an amount equal to your paladin level + your Charisma modifier.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Spelleater
entries: {@i 15th-level Oath of the Witchbane feature}

You can consume magic to augment yourself. Whenever you successfully end a spell of 1st-level or higher with {@spell counterspell} or {@spell dispel magic}, or reduce its damage against you to 0 with your {@subclassFeature Aura of Nullification|Paladin||Witchbane|CoH-CAPG|7|CoH-CAPG} feature, you can consume it, regaining one expended spell slot with a level up to half the spell's level or hit points equal to five times the spell's level (your choice).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arbiter of Magic
entries: {@i 20th-level Oath of the Witchbane feature}
You unleash your full authority over the use of magic. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage on a hit. This damage increases to {@damage 2d8} against creatures concentrating on spells or affected by your {@subclassFeature Disjunction Shackles|Paladin||Witchbane|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG}.

You can use your {@subclassFeature Spell Parry|Paladin||Witchbane|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG} feature without expending uses of your {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin||Witchbane|CoH-CAPG|3|CoH-CAPG}, and you have advantage on attack rolls you make to parry spells with it.

The damage reduction of your {@subclassFeature Aura of Nullification|Paladin||Witchbane|CoH-CAPG|7|CoH-CAPG} is doubled, and if the damage a creature would take from a spell is reduced to 0 by it, but the spell would still affect that creature, the spell has no effect on that creature instead.

entries: Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Soul
entries: Some sorcerers awaken to their power through an event that made pure arcane magic resonate with their very being. Such individuals might have accidentally tapped into a ley line, been experimentd upon in displays of forbidden practices, or been chosen by a deity of magic as champions.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Arcane Soul feature}

You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Arcane Spells table. Each spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a spell from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}.

entries.caption: Arcane Spells
rows: {@spell arcane bolt|CoH-CAPG}, {@spell detect magic}, {@spell magic missile}
{@spell nystul's magic aura||arcanist's magic aura}, {@spell magic weapon}
{@spell bigby's hand||arcane hand}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Weaveborn
entries: {@i 1st-level Arcane Soul feature}
You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} skill, and you can use your Charisma, instead of Intelligence, for any ability checks you make with that skill.

In addition, you and any creature of your choice that touches you can use your own body as an {@item arcane focus|PHB}. When a spell is cast using your body as an {@item arcane focus|PHB}, the caster can ignore any material components of the spell that don't have a gold cost and aren't consumed by the spell. A creature of your choice touching you can also cast the {@spell arcane bolt|CoH-CAPG} cantrip using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability for the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Font of Arcana
entries: {@i 6th-level Arcane Soul feature}
Your innate connection with the Weave makes your magical reserves more potent. The number of sorcery points you have incresases by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

In addition, you learn how to establish a connection between the Weave and others. As an action, you can touch a willing creature and transfer one spell slot you've created with your {@classFeature Font of Magic|Sorcerer||2} feature to it. The target can use the spell slot to cast any spell it knows or has prepred as normal, or to cast any of your {@subclassFeature Arcane Spells|Sorcerer||Arcane Soul|CoH-CAPG|1|CoH-CAPG}, even if it doesn't know any of them. Once a creature receives this benefit, that creature can't receive it again until after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Consume Magic
entries: {@i 6th-level Arcane Soul feature}

When you successfully end a spell with {@spell counterspell} or {@spell dispel magic} or succeed on a saving throw against a spell, you can consume some of the spell's power and regain a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level.
Once you've regained a number of sorcery points equal to half your sorcerer level with this feature, you can't regain sorcery points with it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: {@i 14th-level Arcane Soul feature}
While you are {@condition concentration||concentrating} on a spell, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.

In addition, when a creature can see within 60 feet of you (this can include yourself) makes a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@condition concentration} on a spell, you can use your reaction and spend 1 or more sorcery points to either add or subtract twice the number of sorcery points spent from the roll (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Apotheosis
entries: {@i 18th-level Arcane Soul feature}
You can briefly unite with the Weave, gaining access to extraordinary abilities. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain resistance to the damage of spells and magical effects and your {@condition concentration} can't be broken as a result of taking damage from a spell or magical effect.

You can use any number of different Metamagic options on a spell when you cast it, and you can use any Metamagic option available to the sorcerer class, even if you haven't chosen it with your Font of Power feature.

When another creature you can see within 60 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to use Metamagic on that spell, as if you had cast it, provided the spell is eligible for the Metamagic you use on it.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Arcanist
entries: You've made a pact with a powerful being that manipulates the weave of magic. A powerful archmage that has ascended beyond mortality, a creature whose very nature is magic, or even a deity whose portfolio includes spellcraft has chosen you to be their acolyte, channeling their immense knowledge and understanding over the Art to shape the world around you and further their schemes.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: {@i 1st-level Arcanist feature}
The Arcanist lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Arcanist Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell tenser's floating disk||floating disk}, {@spell magic missile}
{@spell nystul's magic aura||arcanist's magic aura}, {@spell magic weapon}
{@spell glyph of warding}, {@spell protection from energy}
{@spell bigby's hand||arcane hand}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Grimoire
entries: {@i 1st-level Arcanist feature}

Your patron bestows upon you an eldritch grimoire, a book capable of holding arcane secrets and magics. Choose two {@filter 1st-level spells from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=1} to be added to your grimoire. Spells in your grimoire count as warlock spells for you even if they don't appear on the warlock spell list but don't count against the number of warlock spells you know. While you're holding the grimoire, you can cast any spell within it by expending a spell slot as normal, and you can use the grimoire as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

When your {@classFeature Pact Magic|Warlock||1} feature lets you learn a warlock spell of 1st level or higher, you can add another spell of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard} to your grimoire, provided the spell is of a level for which you have spell slots. In addition, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the spells you added to your grimoire with this feature and replace it with another spell from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

If you lose your eldritch grimoire, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous grimoire. The grimoire turns to ash when you die. If you later gain the {@optfeature Pact of the Tome} feature, your grimoire becomes your Book of Shadows.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Arcanum
entries: {@i 1st-level Arcanist feature}

Your eldritch grimoire is a conduit of your patron's power and has a number of charges equal to half your warlock level (rounded up). While holding the grimoire, you can can cast a spell in it with a level equal to or lower than half your proficiency bonus by expending a number of charges equal to the spell's level.
Your grimoire regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Arcana
entries: {@i 6th-level Arcanist feature}

The more you tuck on the weave of magic, the more you can connect with your patron. You can maintain {@condition concentration} on two warlock spells at the same time, provided that at least one of those spells is in your eldritch grimoire and their combined levels are equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up).

If you fail a Constitution saving throw that you make to maintain {@condition concentration} on a spell that's in your grimoire while {@condition concentration||concentrating} on two spells, you lose {@condition concentration} on only one of them (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Surge
entries: {@i 10th-level Arcanist feature}
Through your patron, you've attained a powerful connection with the weave of magic. You have resistance to force damage.

In addition, immediately after you cast a warlock spell, you can use your bonus action and expend one charge from your grimoire to burst with arcane energy. Creatures of your choice you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or take force damage equal to half your warlock level + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Spelleater Arcanum
entries: {@i 14th-level Arcanist feature}

You can devour magic. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, you peer into its magical reserves, choosing one of the spells it can cast and consuming it. Your eldritch grimoire then regains a number of its expended charges up to the consumed spell's level and the consumed spell appears in it, if it isn't in it already. The spell remains in the grimoire until you use this feature again or until you cast it. While a consumed spell is in your grimoire, the creature that you consumed it from can't cast that spell.

If a consumed spell is of 6th-level or higher, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature Mystic Arcanum (6th Level)|Warlock||11||Mystic Arcanum} feature to cast it, as described in your {@classFeature Mystic Arcanum (6th Level)|Warlock||11||Mystic Arcanum} feature. If a creature fails its saving throw to resist the effects of this feature but isn't capable of casting spells, it takes {@damage 10d10} force damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn instead. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Universalist
entries: Out of all wizards, those most studious and dedicated to understanding the Art are called universalists. The path many accomplished archmages chose to walk even as young practitioners, universalists have no care for perfection of a single school of magic or casting style, since they believe in the one True Magic. In pursuing it, they attain incredible mastery of the arcane, being able to reshape magic in ways even their colleagues find extraordinary.

To be a universalist, however, is not only about producing grandiose displays of magical crafting. Universalists, in their core, understand the Weave, the mana, and some say are those closest to peering through the veil of magic itself. While all wizards seek revelations hidden behind the arcane mystery, universalists see magic as the means of perfecting themselves and the world around them.

subclassFeature.name: Arcana Savant
entries: {@i 2nd-level Universalist feature}

Enamored by the beauty of knowledge, you have delved further into the intricate secrets of magic. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} skill. If you are already proficient in the {@skill Arcana} skill, you double your proficiency bonus for any ability check that uses that skill.
In addition, the time you must spend to copy any wizard spell into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Learning
entries: {@i 2nd-level Universalist feature}

Your advanced pace of learning brings forward knowledge untouched by other practitioners of the art. When you gain this feature, choose one spell from any class. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown in the Wizard Table.

You add the chosen spell to your spellbook, and it counts as a wizard spell for you. You add one additional spell from any class to your spellbook at when you reach 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th and 17th level in this class.

You can't choose any spells you gain from this feature with your {@classFeature Spell Mastery|Wizard||18} and {@classFeature Signature Spells|Wizard||20} features, which you gain when you reach higher levels in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Modify Magic
entries: {@i 6th-level Universalist feature}

Your extensive study over the arcane arts allows you to modify spells. When you add or copy a wizard spell in your spellbook, you can choose to modify the spell's formula that you write in your spellbook in the following ways:

entries.name: Alter Energy
entries: If the original spell deals acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage, you can replace the damage type with one other type from that list. If the original spell deals multiple damage type from that list, the new damage type replaces all types from the original spell.

entries.name: Alter Manifestation
entries: If the original spell requires saving throws, you can change a phsyical saving throw (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution) to another physical saving throw of your choice, and you can change a mental saving throw (Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma) to another mental saving throw of your choice.

A spell modified by this feature counts as a different spell from the original and therefore counts against the number of wizard spells you can prepare. For example, a 1st-level wizard universalist that has a scroll containing the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} and wishes to copy the spell to their spellbook can choose to modify the copied spell to deal cold instead of fire damage. If the wizard later decides to also copy the original {@spell burning hands} spell to their spellbook, they can choose to prepare {@spell burning hands}, the modified spell, or both when preparing their wizard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Preparation
entries: {@i 10th-level Universalist feature}
Your studies have taught you the importance of preparation. As a bonus action, you can replace one spell you have prepared with another spell from your spellbook.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: High Arcanum
entries: {@i 14th-level Universalist feature}
Unearthing the deepest parts of the wizard's craft, you gain access to High Arcana. When you finish a long rest, you can choose to gain one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane Fire
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with a spell, you can expend a spell slot to deal extra force damage to that creature. The extra damage is equal to {@damage 2d10} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@scaledamage 3d10|1-9|1d10} for each spell level higher than 1st.

entries.name: Arcane Reach
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can expend a spell slot to increase the range of the spell by 60 feet per level of the spell slot.

entries.name: Archmage's Sight
entries: You are under the effects of a {@spell detect magic} spell.

entries.name: Sage's Knowledge
entries: If your total for an Intelligence check is less than your Intelligence score, you can use that score in place of the total.

entries.name: Spell Power
entries: The spell save DC for your wizard spells increases by 1. The chosen benefit lasts until you finish a long rest. As an action, you expend a 5th-level or higher spell slot to change the chosen benefit to another one.
